meanings.definition: A person who uses deception or trickery to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: The chicaner tried to trick his friends into giving him more candy.
meanings.sent2: The detective realized the chicaner's plan to steal the valuable painting.
meanings.sent3: The chicaner's attempt to cheat at the game was quickly discovered.
meanings.sent4: The chicaner's lies wove a tangled web of deceit around him.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the chicaner's smooth talk and false promises.

meanings.definition: To use deception or trickery in order to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: She would often chicaner her way out of doing chores.
meanings.sent2: The con artist chicanered his victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The magician chicanered the audience with his clever illusions.
meanings.sent4: The fox chicanered its way into the henhouse under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: He chicanered his opponents by pretending to be injured during the match.
